title: Drapers investigates: how fashion retail is carbon offsetting - Drapers
summary: The fashion industry's carbon footprint is significant, with brands increasingly seeking solutions like carbon offsetting and insetting to reduce their emissions. While carbon offsetting can be controversial, businesses like Marks & Spencer, Aldo, and Burberry are investing in various projects, while others like Ganni and On prioritize reducing emissions within their supply chains. Innovation in materials, manufacturing processes, and shipping methods is crucial, with brands like On developing shoes made from recycled carbon emissions.

greenwashing: The article does not suggest that On's Cloudprime shoe is an example of greenwashing, as the innovation is described as a genuine attempt to reduce environmental impact.

title: Govt to buy up €3 million worth of carbon credits from Slovakia to meet climate targets - TheJournal.ie
summary: Ireland is purchasing €2.9 million worth of carbon credits from Slovakia to meet its 2020 emission targets under EU regulations. The credits are being used to comply with emissions targets in sectors like buildings, transport, agriculture, and industry. The move comes as the EU is reforming its carbon market to accelerate emissions cuts and phase out free allowances for industries.

title: Using blockchain to rethink systems and society - Delano.lu
summary: Three startups, Survcoin, Food For Future, and Nash FintechX, are using blockchain technology to address the climate crisis by incentivizing sustainable behavior, empowering farmers, and creating a transparent carbon market. These companies are working to shift the narrative on climate finance, promoting sustainable practices, and making the fight against climate change more accessible to individuals and businesses.

title: 55 Women-Owned Businesses That Give Back & Do Good - Good Good Good
summary: This article highlights women-owned businesses across various sectors, including clothing, home goods, health & beauty, food, lifestyle, pets, and media.
